form.page_subtitle: CWC Diagnostic: CWC HIV Infection> Suspected symptomatic HIV infection Two

field.name: Administer vitamin A when a child is ≥ 6 months of age every 6 months, as given below:
Counsel mother/caregiver on feeding according to the feeding recommendations for HIV exposed children
If possible, test for HIV infection:
If child is ≥ 6 weeks – < 18 months of age, then a Dried Blood Spot sample should be taken for virological testing (DNA PCR)
If child ≥ 18 months of age, then an antibody test should be used for detecting HIV
Give results and provide post-test counseling to mother/caregiver
Refer child to a nearby health facility for HIV care and antiretroviral therapy
Counsel mother/caregiver when to return for care immediately
Counselmother/caregiver to follow-up in 14 days, then monthly for next 3 months, and subsequently every 3 months or per immunization schedule
Record clinical care in Child Health Record “green” book
